stream_context.summary: Kaze debugs an overworld crash, applies basic UV-mapping, and begins building Course 13’s “retro section,” choosing a black-and-white Mario Land 1 plane stage rendered as a forced-perspective rail shooter. He also discusses emulator support and performance ideas.

development_findings.summary: All level geometry received basic UV-mapping off-stream to establish a visual baseline.
development_findings.quote: So what I did off-stream was give everything some basic uv-mapping.

development_findings.summary: A persistent crash was traced to a single coin-formation object; removing three specific formations fixed it.
development_findings.quote: Aha! This was the cause for the crash.

development_findings.summary: The hack assumes the N64 Expansion Pak to simplify memory limits.
development_findings.quote: Yeah, the expansion pack is used here.

development_findings.summary: Course 13’s retro room will recreate Mario Land 1 (World 4-3) as a 60 FPS, forced-perspective rail shooter with locked camera and screen-space movement.
development_findings.quote: It will be forced perspective… It’s gonna be 60 FPS.

development_findings.summary: Visual style for the retro room will be entirely black and white to honor the Game Boy aesthetic.
development_findings.quote: Now we’re definitely doing the whole thing in black and white. That’s essential to the aesthetic.

development_findings.summary: Because the engine lacks true background color clears, a white corridor and optional fog will hide distant geometry.
development_findings.quote: Area background is not supported in this engine… it’s simpler to just do this.

development_findings.summary: A 3D model of Mario’s plane was built from the 16×16 sprite; front faces were deleted, ending at ~420 triangles to stay within budget.
development_findings.quote: This is a decent 3D model… 420 vertices, triangles.

development_findings.summary: Draw layers 5 and 6 were globally swapped to match enum names, requiring updates in every level.
Only Project64 with GlideN64 is officially supported; Kaze works around its bugs instead of chasing issues in multiple emulators, rejecting Parallel.
development_findings.quote: I work around the bugs in this emulator.

development_findings.summary: Kaze believes reorganizing render code to fit one cache line would let original SM64 run 30 FPS and enable quick Luigi integration.
development_findings.quote: The first thing I do is fix the graph render code… and now the entire game runs at 30 FPS.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s parents are visiting Germany for 10 days; he spent three hours helping set up an automatic lawn-mower.
context_findings.quote: My dad decided that we’re setting up the automatic lawnmower today, and I’ve been working in the garden for like three hours.

context_findings.summary: Parents brought roughly 15 new Yoshi plushies, adding to Kaze’s collection.
context_findings.quote: They brought like 15 Yoshis. I have so many Yoshi plushies now.

context_findings.summary: Kaze plans to stream almost daily to increase income, claiming higher efficiency while live.
context_findings.quote: I need to work more because I want to make more money… I’m very efficient working on stream.

context_findings.summary: Frequent frustration and humor surface while debugging crashes—e.g., threats to “scream” at tools and joking about bitcoin mining in the idle thread.

biobak.summary: Joined design chatter; agreed Mario Land 1 plane level and suggested simple asset approaches.

key_stories.title: Coin-Formation Crash Hunt
key_stories.summary: While testing the overworld, the game kept crashing. Kaze first suspected collision triangles, then discovered a faulty coin-formation actor and removed it.
key_stories.process: Removed collision; switched to actor search; isolated three coin formations; deleted the offending object.
key_stories.key_quote: This was the cause for the crash.

key_stories.title: Choosing the Mario Land 1 Plane Stage
key_stories.summary: Kaze needed a pre-SM64 retro concept for Course 13. After weighing submarine vs plane sections, he chose the World 4-3 plane level, defining gameplay, visuals, and technical constraints.
key_stories.challenge: Select a compelling, era-appropriate retro idea.
key_stories.process: Evaluated Mario Land 1/2, submarine vs plane, camera & sprites; consulted chat and Biobak; mandated black-and-white aesthetic.
key_stories.outcome: Committed to a 60 FPS forced-perspective plane shooter with 3D assets.
key_stories.key_quote: Yes, it being Land 1 is non-negotiable.
